item.title: Belisha Beacon (orange flashing globe) and internally illuminated pole not working at the zebra crossing in Beckenham Rd, Beckenham which is the exit from the Beckenham war memorial roundabout into Beckenham Rd, on the footway., 6th January
item.description:
Belisha Beacon (orange flashing globe) and internally illuminated pole not working at the zebra crossing in Beckenham Rd, Beckenham which is the exit from the Beckenham war memorial roundabout into Beckenham Rd, on the footway. I see this has been reported on FMS on 27/11/24 but there is no progress report. If it is a supply problem, I gather it takes longer for the electricity supplier to do a repair. Https://fix.bromley.gov.uk/report/8474451 Please add a 'Belisha Beacon' option to FMS as there is none - neither I think is there an 'pedestrian island globe lamp' option - hence having to report it under illuminated bollards.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): War Memorial, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: You guessed it.....Flytipping, 6th January
item.description:
Another door, wood panels, wooden beams with nails sticking out of varying sizes and a couple of bags of clothes dumped by either a builder or local resident doing building works. Again should all items should be taken to nearest recycle centre and there is a clothes bank, but 30 secs across Wyndham road. Sheer utter laziness. A disregard for other residents and local environment.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pitman Street, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ongoing obstruction of public pavement and waste nuisance, 5th January
item.description:
For over three weeks now, multiple household waste bins and large amounts of rubbish have been left permanently on the public pavement. This has created a serious obstruction for pedestrians and residents. Because of the parking rules in the area we park our cars partially on the pavement, and if a vehicle is parked opposite the bins there is barely any room to pass safely. This is particularly difficult for parents with prams, wheelchair users, and anyone with mobility issues. This situation has persisted for an unreasonable length of time and has not been resolved despite the clear impact on the street and its residents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gordon Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Roman Way, Eden Park, Greater London
